=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/04 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Sam Esmail', 'Jim McKay', 'Tricia Brock', 'Deborah Chow', 'Nisha Ganatra', 'Niels Arden Oplev', 'Christoph Schrewe'], 'Producers': ['Sam Esmail', 'Kyle Bradstreet', 'Steve Golin', 'Chad Hamilton'], 'Starring': ['Rami Malek', 'Christian Slater']} Review Text: Pretty clever plot lines (though not always realistic) and very good acting. Far more interesting than you think a "hacker" drama would be. Definitely R-rated and pushes the limit of that at times. I'll keep watching on Amazon Prime. Review Title: Better than expected for a hacker drama Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/22 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rob Rapley'], 'Producers': ['Rob Rapley', 'Stephanie Haberman Bordas', 'Kathryn Lord'], 'Starring': ['Michael Murphy', 'Shuler Hensley', 'Kathryn Erbe'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} Review Text: Lots of info about presidents Garfield and Arthur I never knew. Garfield could have been one of the best presidents ever. Looks like his doctor did more to kill him than the guy who shot him. Good acting in the docu-drama parts. Very engrossing. Review Title: Well worth your time if you like learning little known history. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/11/02 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Paul Giamatti', 'Laura Linney', 'Stephen Dilane'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: Johnny A finally gets his due! And Abigail too!
Fantastic acting. Great production quality for a period piece.
Adams, Jefferson, Washington, Hamilton, and Franklin are all here. Review Title: Entertaining and educational! All the founding fathers excellently portrayed--but Abigail steals the show! This is a drama about a retired Sherlock slipping into senility. Mystery fans will be disappointed. Review Title: Boring but well-acted drama. Not a Sherlock mystery movie. Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Heist Review Date: 2017/01/25 Categories: Suspense, Action, Cerebral, Intense Product Description: ["A casino card dealer, desperate to pay for his daughter's life-saving surgery, teams up with a co-worker to pull off a casino heist, but as the plan falters they find themselves hijacking a bus and using the hostages as collateral."] Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Scott Mann'], 'Producers': ['Randall Emmett', 'George Furla', 'Wayne Marc Godfrey', 'Robert Jones', 'Stephen Sepher', 'Alexander Tabrizi'], 'Starring': ['Dave Bautista', 'Jeffrey Dean Morgan', 'Robert De Niro']} Review Text: Major plot flaws in an otherwise clever heist film. Despite that, it was worth watching (for free with Prime membership). Review Title: This is not a DeNiro caliber film--but somewhat enjoyable. Williams : Ms. Fine']} Review Text: Funny, funny, funny!!!
Not for prudes! Review Title: Funny funny girls!!! Great writing. Thoroughly entertaining. Funny. So much better than most big studio movies. Review Title: Fun movie about about artists and the art world. Great Indy film. Review Title: Austin, TX in 1990. Kooky fun. Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual exhibits a strong preference for high-quality narratives that blend drama, historical context, and social commentary. They consistently rate engaging plots and competent acting highly, reflected in their average ratings which rarely fall below 4.0. The preferences lean towards content that is R-rated, often involving complex themes such as crime, politics, and historical events, indicating a taste for mature and thought-provoking material.

Recurring themes noted include a penchant for well-crafted period pieces and biographical dramas, suggesting an appreciation for educational storytelling. The subject also enjoys comedies that maintain a strong sense of humor and authenticity, but does not shy away from darker or more intense content when the quality is assured.

Quality appears to be a significant factor in their purchasing behavior, as they express dissatisfaction with poorly executed narratives, leading to notably lower ratings for such content. Price sensitivity seems minimal, as they exhibit a willingness to explore various genres and production scales, favoring content that is either critically acclaimed or offers substantial entertainment value. Overall, the person clearly seeks impactful viewing experiences that provide depth, humor, and strong performances.

target_interaction.title: Um... yeah... interesting Indy film.
target_interaction.text: Kooky and offbeat. Fun. Weird. Like most Indy films, not for those who only like traditional Hollywood narratives.  Debra Winger is in it.
